A <math alttext="2.00 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mole</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of <math alttext="H 2 O, solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> melted, producing <math alttext="H 2 O, liquid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>l</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on the diagram, which of the following best describes the amount of heat required for this process and the changes that took place at the molecular level?

choices.label: <math alttext="3.01 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.01</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat was absorbed to decrease the average speed of the water molecules in the liquid, which decreases the distance between molecules.

<math alttext="6.02 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.02</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat was absorbed to increase the number of hydrogen bonds between water molecules in the liquid compared to the solid.

<math alttext="12.0 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat was absorbed to decrease the polarity of the water molecules, which increases the density of the liquid compared to the solid.

<math alttext="12.0 kilojoules" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kJ</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of heat was absorbed to overcome some of the hydrogen bonding forces holding the water molecules in fixed positions in the crystalline structure.
